args.natural_language_statement: Let (X,d) be a metric space. Suppose K ⊂ X is compact. Prove that K is the union of finitely many open balls of radius ε, for every ε > 0. Translate to Lean4. Use Mathlib import at top and end the Lean statement with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Lean Meta
open Elab
open Tactic
open Qq
open Mathlib.Tactic.TryThis
open Lean.Meta.Rewrites
open Lean.Meta.LazyDiscrTree (ModuleDiscrTreeRef)
open Elab.Tactic.SolveByElim in
open Elab.Tactic.SolveByElim in
open Elab.Tactic.SolveByElim in
open Lean.Parser.Tactic (rwRuleSeq)
open Lean.Elab.Tactic (liftMetaTactic liftMetaTactic' TacticM getMainGoal)

/-- Based on the full conversation history and the provided examples (if any), gen

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X]

/-- If K is compact, then for every ε > 0 there is a finite set of centers whose ε-balls
cover K. -/
theorem compact_is_finite_ball_cover {K : Set X} (hK : IsCompact K) :
  ∀ ε : ℝ, 0 < ε → ∃ s : Finset X, K ⊆ ⋃ x ∈ s, Ball x ε := by sorry

result:

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X]

/-- If K is compact, then for every ε > 0 there is a finite set of centers whose ε-balls
cover K. -/
theorem compact_is_finite_ball_cover {K : Set X} (hK : IsCompact K) :
  ∀ ε : ℝ, 0 < ε → ∃ s : Finset X, K ⊆ ⋃ x ∈ s, Ball x ε := by sorry

args.query: mathlib4 IsCompact location module Mathlib.Topology.IsCompact Mathlib.Topology.Compactness

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X]

/-- If K is compact, then for every ε > 0 there is a finite set of centers (lying in K)
whose ε-balls cover K. -/
theorem IsCompact.exists_finite_ball_cover (K : Set X) (hK : IsCompact K) (ε : ℝ)
  (hε : 0 < ε) : ∃ s : Finset X, s ⊆ K ∧ K ⊆ ⋃ x ∈ s, Ball x ε := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X]

/-- If K is compact, then for every ε > 0 there is a finite set of centers (lying in K)
whose ε-balls cover K. -/
theorem IsCompact.exists_finite_ball_cover (K : Set X) (hK : IsCompact K) (ε : ℝ) (hε : 0 < ε) :
  ∃ s : Set X, s.Finite ∧ s ⊆ K ∧ K ⊆ ⋃ x ∈ s, Metric.ball x ε := by sorry
